title: Economic Data Release at Risk Amid Congressional Spending Deadlock
snippets: Funding will be cut off unless Republicans and Democrats can agree a way forward on a spending bill.
A US government shutdown could result in layoffs of federal workers.
The US could see its first government shutdown in almost seven years as both parties stand firm on their demands.

The United States is facing yet another government shutdown. What happens and who is impacted when the government can't pay its bills? And could the Trump administration use it as an excuse for more layoffs?
A potential shutdown of the U.S. government looms at midnight, as President Donald Trump and members of congress work toward a deal to avert it.
Key economic data will be delayed if lawmakers fail to break funding deadlock
Employee furloughs and potential layoffs would halt some government activities if the U.S. government shuts down by midnight Tuesday.
titles: Why the US government might shut down and when it might happen
Why is the US government on the brink of a shutdown? What will it mean?
US government shutdown looms amid 'large differences'
What does a US government shutdown actually mean?
The US government may shut down at midnight. Here's what to know
What happens if the US government shuts down?
What U.S. services could be hit by a government shutdown?
summary: Funding for key economic data is at risk as Republicans and Democrats struggle to agree on a spending bill. If no resolution is reached, the release of crucial economic information could be delayed.

title: Spotify Founder Daniel Ek to Step Down as CEO, Become Chairman
snippets: The founder of the world's biggest music streaming service says he'll remain at the company as Executive Chairman, and will be replaced by two co-CEOs.
Spotify CEO Daniel Ek to step aside  Axios
Spotify's CEO Daniel Ek is set to step down in January next year and move to the role of Executive Chairman, the company said on Tuesday.

Ek founded Stockholm-based music streaming company nearly two decades ago and will stay on as executive chair

Spotify said Tuesday that founder Daniel Ek is stepping down as CEO to become the executive chair.

The Stockholm-b
titles: Spotify's Daniel Ek announces that he'll step aside as CEO
Spotify CEO Daniel Ek to step aside - Axios
Spotify founder Daniel Ek stepping down as CEO, company names co-CEOs to replace him
Spotify founder Daniel Ek steps down from CEO role
summary: Daniel Ek, founder of Spotify, will step down as CEO in January to become Executive Chairman. Spotify, which achieved its first full-year profitability last year, will appoint Gustav Söderström and Alex Norström as co-CEOs. Ek founded the Stockholm-based music streaming company nearly two decades ago.

title: Scientists Develop Technique to Create Eggs from Skin Cells for Infertility Trea
snippets: Scientists created the eggs using DNA from adult skin cells, a step that could someday potentially lead to new ways to treat infertility and enable gay couples to have genetically related children.
US scientists testing the technique say it could help people overcome infertility and potentially allow same-sex couples to have a genetically related child.
An innovative use of skin cells could provide a route for gay couples or women with fertility problems to have children they are both genetically related to
The embryos weren’t used to try to establish a pregnancy, but the researchers behind the technique say it could one day be used to address infertility.
titles: Scientists create human eggs in the lab, using skin cells
Scientists make embryos from human skin DNA for first time
Egg cells made with DNA from human skin fertilised in the lab
Scientists Made Human Eggs From Skin Cells and Used Them to Form Embryos
summary: Scientists have developed a technique to create eggs from the DNA of adult skin cells, offering a potential future treatment for infertility. This method could also enable gay couples to have genetically related children. However, the embryos created were not used to attempt pregnancy. The researchers believe this approach could one day help address infertility issues.

title: Trump, Netanyahu Agree on Gaza Peace Deal; Hamas Approval Pending
snippets: Details are key in any peace agreement. Donald Trump’s 20-point plan for Gaza is notably lacking in them.
US President Donald Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu say they agree on a new Gaza peace deal.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiigFBVV95cUxOeHlpLWZjbFpUazZha2YxampoeWJfUktad1haSV9tMC1LdTZjNVdqUkR1OElXbmxkeG9uODl3MGlMUFBuTDlwQnJPbzRpMG02MGdKakVDcjUzY1RoVFFSVTlYcC1VSTl5dFYwUDNCTlVkOXZnTUJhZjRuNWxjdGJULU1MODFjRWNKaGc?oc=5" target="_blank">Qatar, Egypt and Turkey urge Hamas to ac
The Israeli premier’s reluctance to fully withdraw troops or make way for a Palestinian state, combined with Hamas’s reluctance to disarm, may result in a fragile deal, analysts say.

It would end the war and secure the release of all hostages. Hamas would give up its arms and its power, while a transitional government is set up. Hamas has not agreed and the terms will be hard for it to swallow.
titles: Trump’s Gaza peace plan has 20 points but few details
Key takeaways from US President Trump’s ‘Gaza peace plan’
Qatar, Egypt and Turkey urge Hamas to accept Trump's Gaza peace plan - Axios
Netanyahu tries to sell Trump’s Gaza peace plan to a skeptical right wing
Trump’s Gaza Plan: What We Know
summary: US President Donald Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu have agreed on a new Gaza peace deal, lacking detailed information. The deal aims to end the war and secure the release of all hostages by having Hamas disarm and relinquish power for a transitional government. However, challenges arise from Netanyahu's reluctance to withdraw troops or allow a Palestinian state, and Hamas's hesitation to disarm. The outcome remains uncertain as Hamas has yet to agree to the terms.

title: Ex-Congo President Kabila Sentenced to Death in Absentia for Multiple Crimes
snippets: Head of military tribunal says Kabila convicted of several crimes, including treason, murder and torture.
Former Congolese President Joseph Kabila was sentenced to death in absentia by a military court. He was found guilty of treason and complicity with the M23 militia.

Military court convicts Kabila of war crimes, treason and other offences in verdict that could fuel enduring tensions

A military court in the Democratic Republic of the Congo has sentenced the country’s former president Joseph Kabila to death in absentia after convicting him of war crimes,
Joseph Kabila, who was president of the Democratic Republic of Congo for 18 years, was convicted of treason by a court in Kinshasa.
titles: DR Congo’s ex-President Joseph Kabila sentenced to death in absentia
Congo: Death sentence for former leader Joseph Kabila
Former DRC president Joseph Kabila sentenced to death in absentia
Congo’s Former President Sentenced to Death in Absentia
summary: Former Congolese President Joseph Kabila was sentenced to death in absentia by a military court in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. He was convicted of several crimes, including treason, murder, torture, and complicity with the M23 militia. This verdict comes after Kabila's 18-year presidency and could escalate tensions in the region.

title: South African Ambassador to France Found Dead in Paris
snippets: The circumstances around Nathi Mthethwa's death are being investigated by the French authorities.
South African Ambassador Nkosinathi Emmanuel "Nathi" Mthethwa was found dead outside of a high-rise hotel in Paris.
Ambassador Nkosinathi Emmanuel "Nathi" Mthethwa's body was discovered outside a Paris hotel. The circumstances of his death are under investigation.
The police are investigating the death of the ambassador, Nkosinathi Emmanuel Mthethwa, as a possible suicide.
titles: South Africa's top diplomat in France found dead near Paris hotel
South African Ambassador to France found dead outside Paris hotel
South Africa's ambassador to France found dead in Paris
South African Ambassador to France Is Found Dead in Paris
summary: South African Ambassador Nkosinathi Emmanuel "Nathi" Mthethwa was found dead outside a high-rise hotel in Paris. French authorities are investigating the circumstances of his death, with police considering it a possible suicide.

title: Afghanistan Faces First Nationwide Internet Outage Under Taliban Rule
snippets: The outage was the first nationwide shutdown since the Taliban returned to power in August 2021 and was part of their professed crackdown on immorality.
Fiber-optic and mobile internet access has been cut off, and experts warn of serious consequences for trade and girls' access to education.
Two weeks after the regime signaled plans to ban fiber-optic internet, nearly all links to the outside world are cut, grounding planes and closing businesses.
titles: The U.N. mission appeals to the Taliban to restore internet access in Afghanistan
Taliban's internet shutdown in Afghanistan: What's at stake?
Taliban internet shutdown paralyzes Afghanistan
summary: In Afghanistan, a nationwide internet outage occurred for the first time since the Taliban's return to power in August 2021, as part of a crackdown on immorality. This disruption, resulting from the Taliban's plans to ban fiber-optic internet, severed fiber-optic and mobile internet access, affecting trade, education for girls, grounding planes, and closing businesses.

title: 6.9-Magnitude Earthquake in Philippines Kills 6, Injures Many
snippets: Rescue efforts under way after quake off Cebu island sends people running into the streets, damages buildings.

Power knocked out and buildings and roads damaged as rescuers search for casualties

A 6.9-magnitude quake has struck off the the central Philippines coast, damaging buildings and roads and knocking out power in parts of the region,

MANILA, Philippines (AP) — An offshore earthquake of magnitude 6.9 jolted the central Philippines and collapsed the walls of buildings late Tuesday, killing at least six people, injuring several more and sending residents scrambling out of homes into darkness as the intense shaking cut off power, of
titles: Deaths reported after powerful earthquake hits off Philippines coast
Central Philippines hit by powerful 6.9-magnitude earthquake
Strong earthquake in central Philippines kills at least 6 people and damages houses and buildings
summary: A 6.9-magnitude earthquake hit off the coast of the central Philippines, causing at least six deaths and injuring several others. The quake, which occurred late Tuesday, led to widespread damage, including collapsed buildings and damaged roads, and knocked out power in parts of the region. Rescue efforts are underway as residents and authorities deal with the aftermath.

summary: Approximately 750,000 federal workers are at risk of furloughs due to a potential government shutdown. Despite the risk, some federal employees are indifferent to the possibility of a shutdown. The shutdown could also freeze the IPO market. Democrats are demanding that any temporary funding measure to prevent the shutdown includes an extension of enhanced Affordable Care Act tax credits set to expire at the end of 2025. Federal workers were notified via email about the potential furloughs associated with the shutdown.

title: Deepti Sharma Leads India to Win Over Sri Lanka in World Cup Opener
snippets: Deepti Sharma scores a half-century and takes three wickets as India seal a 59-run win over Sri Lanka in the opening match of the Women's World Cup.

• India, 269-8, beat Sri Lanka, 211, by 59 runs (DLS)

  • Sharma scores 53 and takes three wickets in Guwahati

Deepti Sharma impressed with bat and ball as India beat fellow co-hosts Sri Lanka by 59 runs (Duckworth-Lewis-Stern method) in the rain-affected opening
Amanjot Kaur scored her maiden Women's Cricket World Cup half-century as India began their campaign with a 59-run victory (DLS Method) over Sri Lanka in a rain-affected opening encounter in Guwahati.
titles: India impress to beat Sri Lanka in World Cup opener
Deepti Sharma leads India rally to deny Sri Lanka in Cricket World Cup opener
Amanjot impresses as India beat Sri Lanka in rain-affected World Cup opener
summary: Deepti Sharma starred with a half-century and three wickets, leading India to a 59-run victory over Sri Lanka under the Duckworth-Lewis-Stern method in the rain-affected Women's World Cup opener in Guwahati. Amanjot Kaur also scored her maiden World Cup half-century, contributing to India's total of 269-8 before restricting Sri Lanka to 211.

title: Imgur Blocks UK Access Amid Plans for Child Data Fine
snippets: The image-hosting platform - which is widely used to make memes - was facing a fine over its use of children's data.

The image-sharing site Imgur has shut off access to UK users after the country’s data watchdog warned the platform of a fine, as reported earlier by the BBC. In a post on Imgur’s help page, Imgur confirms that users in the UK can no longer log in, view content, or upload images starting September 30
Imgur, one of the web's most popular image sharing and hosting platforms, has shut off access to its site in the U.K., following a notice of a fine by the country's data protection watchdog.
titles: Image site Imgur blocks access to UK users after regulator warned of fine
Imgur is blocking users in the UK
Imgur pulls out of UK after data regulator warns of fines
summary: Imgur, a popular image-sharing platform, has blocked access to its site in the U.K. after the country's data protection watchdog announced plans to fine the company for improperly using children's data.

title: Nigel Wright, Ex-Harper Chief of Staff and Onex Executive, Dies
snippets: Wright was Harper's chief of staff from 2011 to 2013, but left that high-profile position over his involvement in the Senate expenses scandal.

OTTAWA — Nigel Wright, a longtime Canadian businessman and former top aide to prime minister Stephen Harper, has died. Onex, the private equity firm where Wright worked for nearly three decades, announced his death in a post today. The firm’s president and CEO, Bobby LeBlanc, says in a stateme
titles: Nigel Wright, former top aide to Stephen Harper, dead at 62
Nigel Wright, former chief of staff to Stephen Harper, dead at age 62
summary: Nigel Wright, a Canadian businessman and former chief of staff to Prime Minister Stephen Harper from 2011 to 2013, has passed away. Wright, known for his involvement in the Senate expenses scandal, was a longtime executive at Onex, a private equity firm. His death was confirmed by Onex's president and CEO, Bobby LeBlanc.

title: Dolphins' Tyreek Hill Out for Season with Knee Injury
snippets: Dolphins wide receiver Tyreek Hill may not need multiple surgeries after dislocating his left knee, coach Mike McDaniel said on Tuesday, a day after the Miami veteran suffered the gruesome injury during the team's 27-21 victory over the New York Jets.
Miami Dolphins wide receiver Tyreek Hill is out for the season with torn ligaments in his knee after injuring it during his side's 27-21 win over the New York Jets.
titles: Dolphins' Hill may not need multiple surgeries
Dolphins star Hill out for season
summary: Miami Dolphins wide receiver Tyreek Hill will miss the rest of the season due to torn ligaments in his left knee, an injury sustained during a 27-21 victory over the New York Jets. Despite initial concerns, Dolphins coach Mike McDaniel indicated that Hill might not require multiple surgeries for the dislocation.

title: Amazon Unveils New Alexa+ Smart Devices, Including Dot Max and Echo Show 11
snippets: Amazon unveiled a slew of new smart speakers and displays that are revamped with Alexa+, its personal assistant powered by generative artificial intelligence.
Amazon debuts new devices, the Dot Max, Echo Studio, Echo Show 8, and Echo Show 11, powered by AI.
Amazon announced new Fire TV devices, 4K Stick, and Alexa+ AI features for TV viewers.
titles: Amazon's new Echo devices designed for Alexa+ start at $99
Amazon unveils new Echo devices, powered by its AI, Alexa+
Alexa+ comes to new Fire TV devices with AI-powered conversations
summary: Amazon announced new smart speakers and displays, including the Dot Max, Echo Studio, Echo Show 8, and Echo Show 11, all integrated with Alexa+, a version of its assistant enhanced with generative artificial intelligence. This upgrade, dubbed Alexa Plus, will be included in these devices from the start, offering advanced AI capabilities to users. This move aims to expand the presence of Amazon's AI-powered assistant in homes.

title: Microsoft Unveils AI-Powered "Agent Mode" for Excel and Word
snippets: Microsoft debuts "vibe working" in Office
Agent Mode in Word, Excel works like vibe coding tools but for knowledge work.
titles: Microsoft debuts "vibe working" in Office - Axios
With new agent mode for Excel and Word, Microsoft touts “vibe working”
summary: Microsoft has launched a new feature called "Agent Mode" for its Excel and Word applications, enabling users to generate complex spreadsheets and documents through simple AI prompts, a concept similar to "vibe coding." This innovation aims to simplify app usage and enhance productivity.
